intro: Stylidium piliferum subsp. minor, commonly known as the small-stemmed triggerplant, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, linear leaves. The plant produces striking, bright red or orange flowers that are typically borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. It is a sun-loving species that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
